website_summaries.verdict: The affordable price and decent build makes this motherboard worth considering for gamers who don't want to spend a lot of money.
pros: Responsive, as it's compatible with 2nd Gen AMD Ryzen AM4 and 7th Gen Athlon processors
Fairly easy to install, so it's a good choice for gamers putting together first builds
cons: Fan slot is difficult to differentiate from other ports
BIOS updates are likely needed and can be tricky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent B450 board
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best Ryzen motherboard you should get if you don’t intend to use SLI. The VRM supplies stable power compared to my old MSi motherboard. The components are high quality, and the RGB lighting adds a nice touch. The audio codec needed some tuning, it might be a bug. But it was quickly fixed. Aura Sync worked seemlessly, but some of the gimmicks you won’t need. Fan control is excellent. With my Ryzen 2700 and a Arctic Freezer 33 cooler, I was able to reach 4.2 GHz at a comfortable temperature of 60 degrees C. Way better than the crashing with MSi. Overall, I don’t see any reason not to like the board.
customer_reviews.author: Linh Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 2 brands of memory It did not run 3000 or 3200 It runs just the stock speed of 2133 Maybe needs a bios update
customer_reviews.author: Bandar abdulmohsin al luhaibi

customer_reviews.title: Crashes with 'Memory Issues'
customer_reviews.text: MBoard crashes intermittently, and a flashing yellow light comes on to indicate an issue with the RAM. Tested with the Windows Memory diagnostic tool, and no errors there (i.e. RAM checks out OK). Sent to Asus for repair, they 'fixed it' by updating the firmware. Motherboard still crashes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Varney

customer_reviews.title: POS- DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: THIS POS DIED AFTER JUST ABOUT 3 HOURS OF PLAYING ROBLOX. AT FIRST THE USB PORTS WOULDN'T WORK AND YES THEY WERE ENABLED IN THE BIOS. AFTER THAT IT JUST DIED, THIS IS AN ABSOLUTE WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY. I WILL BE GETTING A GIGABYTE AFTER THIS SINCE MY OTHER GIGABYTE BUILD IS STILL RUNNING FALWLESSY AFTER A YEAR WITH THE SAME SOCKET.
customer_reviews.author: Tuna's Castle

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice MOBO. Works great with Ryzen 7 2700x CPU! Had a little trouble plugging in one of my USB 2.0 into its slot but with some careful applied pressure, it went into place. Love the bios set up and updated it from one of ASUS's beta applications. It was a breeze. Very satisfied with my purchase so far. I recommend this MOBO for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Skynet_187

customer_reviews.title: For the $130 price point, great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This thing is slick looking. it has 5 fan headers plus a an AIO cooler header. 2 RGB headers, onboard USB-C. Its ASUS so the BIOS is great. You cant go wrong with this board. the only thing that is a non-issue is the I/O shield covers some of the VRM's so without having a probe thermometer I cant tell if its messing with the thermals. ive got a stable 4.1mhz overclock with 1.41 volts on my Ryzen 2600. This thing is really nice. also if your not big into ASUS ( which you should be) the MSI B450 tomahawk is another top o the line B450 board. Good Luck
customer_reviews.author: Justin. B

customer_reviews.title: Great features for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was told by Asus tech support that this motherboard would work out of the box with a Ryzen 3600x while everything I saw online said It would require a Bios update before it would boot. I decided to get it and see if Asus was right, it booted right up after I installed the processor without issue, I then installed the newest Bios before installing Windows. Everything went smoothly and I would recommend this motherboard to any looking for a budget gaming motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect OoB experience. Amazing board
customer_reviews.text: Paired with my 3600 immediately. I was expecting to need to BIOS flash and reinstall windows, but nope perfect. Also works perfectly with the Sabrent m.2 SSD i got for the ryzen 2 system and the corsair 16gb (2x8 sticks) of 3600 RAM. Literally just went to BIOS and then everything was golden. Wanted a few extra drivers with were on ASUS's support site really easy to find and like magic I skyrocketed to modernity.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew DiMasi

customer_reviews.title: Been using it for 6 months with my Ryzen 3600
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 issues with this motherboard. The most annoying one is that the computer reboots randomly every 2 weeks or so. I have switched out the power supply, memory and CPU so the motherboard is all that's left. RMA? I'd be left without a motherboard so I need to buy another one. Secondly, the USB-C adapter (blue one) just got stuck onto this motherboard and would not let go. Thirdly, this motherboard definitely makes it look like the some parts are RGB and would light up, but it doesn't. Other than that, it's a great motherboard. But the random reboot during a ranked game makes me sometime want to abuse my "gaming" motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: K. Yagi

customer_reviews.title: Such A Good Looking Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: In 30 years of building computers I have never seen a motherboard as beautiful as this. It's also my first Asus motherboard and now I know what all the fuss is about. It was simple to setup, worked without issues with m.2. Ryzen 5 3600 support out of the box. I haven't had any issues with it. I wish it was in a case that had glass to see it. No issues with any of the PCIe cards I'm using with it. For the features, looks ease of use, and great price, this is a nice board to have. Especially if you're case has glass.
customer_reviews.author: What the Frack?!

customer_reviews.title: Sad:(
customer_reviews.text: Gave me a defective item tried touse different power supplies no power would go to the Mobo I then tried to rule out if it was power supply issue by testing two other boards and they worked flawlessly as the PSU fan started spinning now I'm waiting through the long process of sending it back to geta refund and then get another one hopefully in working condition was going to be my first PC build with brand new parts really disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: april

customer_reviews.title: clunky and problematic - no onboard video despite having ports
customer_reviews.text: First off, the design leaves a bit to be desired. The memory slots are too close to the CPU/fan and if you don't have the right, very compact cooling system, you can't access all the DIMM slots. Second, THERE IS NO ONBOARD GRAPHICS... even though there's an HDMI and Displayport on the motherboard, if you use a processor like the Ryzen 2600, the machine won't boot unless you put an external display card in it. There is no onboard graphics. The manual is not very comprehensive. There's very little troubleshooting information.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Pennington

customer_reviews.title: 3000 series
customer_reviews.text: I just got the board yesterday. It comes in 3000 series ready. I even got a call from asus telling me this. I give an updated review when I start overclocking my ram and cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: It's VR compatible and worth the value and style
customer_reviews.text: The board is okay and function properly way better than my old motherboard. It's VR compatible and it works flawlessly with my rift. I have not overclocked it yet because I have the stock cooler installed for now. The thing I don't like about it is the way it's built cheaply and cost-effective. And it can can perform very well with this value.
customer_reviews.author: Ra Drumba

customer_reviews.title: Two separate boards arrived broken, can't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this for my first gaming PC build, and I cannot express how disappointed I was. The first board arrived seeming fine, no visible damage whatsoever. After completely assembling the board with a professional PC Tech, we attempted to post the PC and run bios, but there was no power or response, and we noticed a smell of burnt plastic or formaldehyde. I still can't tell if the board fried my CPU, or if the board arrived broken and shorted itself, but both the mobo and cpu were rendered useless. The second board arrived completely soaked with water and the board itself had water on it, we immediately threw it away, huge waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Scoundrel

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite motherboard designs!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Dual NVMe M.2 slots -Supports up to 64 gigabytes of 3200MH DDR4 memory which pairs well with the Ryzen processors -Aura Sync RGB lighting with 2 additional headers -Pre-mounted I/O shield -Plenty of fan headers even for my full tower case -Easy BIOS flashing Cons- -For the life of me, I cannot get the light on the motherboard to shut off after powering the pc down. I've gone through all the settings and thought I found the option in the BIOS but it doesn't seem to do anything. Overall- Great budget motherboard with extra room for expansion down the road as you need it. I highly recommend this board if you're on the fence about it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps it should be Asus Rock?
customer_reviews.text: The board looks amazing, feels solid in the hands, was easy to mount and setup. Supports fairly new technology in CPU, Memory, Video, PCI and etc. Performance for gaming and general use has proven to be rock solid. I have had no issues with the board neither directly or indirectly. IF there was anything I would complain about it would be the Bios, it's not exactly user-friendly and is not quite as flexible as some other boards in its class. Nonetheless, I would certainly recommend this board to beginners and pros alike. Certainly an excellent investment!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Cordle

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Used in a new rig I built for video editing. Power management features are great. Ultra-fast boot mode, standby, and hibernation work fine. Tweaking of RAM and other overclocking features are supported, although I did not use them myself. My system has worked perfectly for the last few months and have no complaints. All drivers installed and updated without issue from the website. ASUS makes a great motherboard and probably can't be beat at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T.

customer_reviews.title: Well packaged, and happy with performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first AMD build, for a media PC. The first mother board, was defective. Would always randomly restart. The second one,seemingly, is working just fine. I always like ASUS products, and this board seems to fit my needs. I updated the BIOS, and the settings in the BIOS, are user friendly, in my opinion. I don't over clock, and based on default settings with this mother board, as I said earlier, it fits my needs just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Tim D

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard seemed solid, i bought it and it worked fine for 3 months. Last week and today the motherboard randomly don't wanted to turn on. I discart the idea of the power supply may be defective because the motherboard gets power from the power supply, the RGB LED turns on, the only thing is that when I press the power button dosen't do anything, and shorting the pwr pins also does nothing... I'm trying to get ASUS Support to resolve this issue ASAP, and from my experience, this will be the last ASUS ROG product that I bought from now on.
customer_reviews.author: TintesPR

customer_reviews.title: Good MB for mid range value.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice MB from ASUS. Minimal RGB on the board itself. I am not into RGB. Gimme a nice Fractal case (quiet running), good air cooling and I am a happy guy. (Radiators belong in cars, not PC's). Updated the board BIOS, set the ram, bumped the CPU to 4.0GHz (it will do 4.2GHz) and everything is running just fine. I put in a Ryzen 2600 and when AMD releases the next gen next spring I will probably update the processor again. 10-15-18 Amazon has the Ryzen 2600 on sale for $150, that is a GOOD deal!
customer_reviews.author: Chili

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a (ancient) motherboard with this one. No issues after finding out that the miss-alignment of the PCI slots to the case was due to an issue with the case. With the M2 SSD, this boots to the login screen really, really fast. Warning: the SATA ports are not all usable unless you are setting up a RAID configuration. We are unable to have the OS recognize a DVD or disk drive connected to SATA 5 or 6.
customer_reviews.author: als

customer_reviews.title: Stable mothertboard and drivers
customer_reviews.text: I have not toyed with overclocking capabilities after assembling my computer a year after ordering the stuff piece by piece. But right out of the box it worked. I flashed the BIOS to 3003 after I installed windows to upgrade in the future to a Ryzen 9 3950X. One concern is the memory placement. Looks like they can block the heatsink from mounting if taller than DDR4 specs, like a bigger heatsink.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R Gandia

customer_reviews.title: Best of this chip series
customer_reviews.text: The b450 chipset is great, especially on this board. it works absolutely amazing, id reccomend an AMD RYZEN 5 2600 to pair with this, the compatability seems to be the smoothest with this board. BIOS is honestly one of the best configurations ive ever seen, especially if youre into overclocking. simple interface and setup. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Nate long

customer_reviews.title: Liked it enough to buy again for a second build
customer_reviews.text: If it tells you anything, this is the second time I've bought this board (for 2 different PC builds). First for a ryzen 2700X when that was the latest, then for the Ryzen 3700X when that came out. The product page doesn't really say it well, but these come Ryzen 3000 series ready right out of the box now. Either way, it is just about the best bang for your buck you can get if you want the Asus ROG line.
customer_reviews.author: Arin Feller

customer_reviews.title: Very good motherboard
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent motherboard I am very satisfied with the performance that I have given until now, I have it with a ryzen 2700 and it works perfectly well in summary it is a very good motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Eduar Altamirano

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Motherboard! It solved all of my issues I had with my previous board that had a dead pcie main slot for my graphics card and installing all the drivers needed to function in windows was super easy and stable gaming and everyday use is smooth! I am sticking to this board for at least 5+ yrs and if I want to upgrade my cpu all I have to do is update the bios but I don't need to since I don't want to upgrade just yet since my R5 1600 cpu is still kicking butt! Love AMD!
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Davenport Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Super good!
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised by how pro this MoBo is, considering is not an X450, but a mundane B series MoBo. I have my computer built around an X series MoBo and it seriously lacks behind this one. The installation is always a painful process to me because of the IO panel gets messy, but that is just me being impaired for that. After booting the computer and checking temps and performance, I can attest this was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jovao do Santos

customer_reviews.title: Will not post or detect hardware. Cramped layout.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to build a whole new rig - except the mosterboard doesn't detect anything. No monitor, videocard, mouse, or keyboard. I'm going to have to return it because it won't post, but that's not its only detractors: The motherboard is cramped - you can't fit four sticks of RAM in because otherwise the ram will be undocked by the CPU fan. There's a lot of necessary, decorative add ons that make it impossible to attach the power cords or peripherals without slicing your finger tips or knuckles on it.
customer_reviews.author: Regina B.

customer_reviews.title: Only one week! Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Only work when first time power on. Go on a family trip and when I return tried to turn the new Pc on and nothing works. Not even LED lights. Power supply works ok, now claim warranty. Maybe because I’m have a ryzen3700X and bios should be update. But even like that it was working before. I move to gigabite.
customer_reviews.author: valion31

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, but may require a little tinkering to get everything running smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Didn't recognize my NVME drive right away, but after a reboot or two it started finding the drive. Not sure what changed, but it's working great now. I also had a bit of trouble getting my 3200 RAM to work correctly. I found a solution online but it would have been nice to see that information in the BIOS or manual. If I could give it 4 3/4 stars I think that would be accurate, but now that it's up and running, it performs very well. BIOS has a lot of settings to tinker with so if you're into that, you should be pretty happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY happy with this upgrade! The board was very easy to install. Worked from the first moment I plugged it all in. The only issue I came across was when I was trying to install my CPU cooler (the bracket was sideways compared to my old mobo?) so I had to use the stock cooler that came with the processor -- not the worst thing but a little disappointing. My old mobo also had more spots for my case fans? But that's not a big deal either as one of my fans was slightly broken anyway. It looks very nice and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Tessier

customer_reviews.title: Awsome M.B.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great, BIOS menu leaves some to be desired but not too much, mine DID NOT come with manual and was a refurbished unit, called seller and was told i had to select new or refurb. At checkout, there was no option like this for me! They offered to send me a brand new one but i said i wasnt going to wait and used the refub one, product works excellent, would definatley recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts / refurbished board received instead of new item
customer_reviews.text: I received a MB inside a white box (not original packaging as shown in product photos) with a pack of screws for the m.2 slots and a 2-pack of sata cables. Everything else shown to be included in the product photos missing - including the CPU bracket/backplate. Without this backplate, no cooler will mount to the board. Had to order an additional backplate from 2another supplier as I didn't have one on hand. Upon closer inspection I discovered I was sent a refurbished board. I checked all over the product page and didn't see anywhere that I was purchasing a refurbished product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Solid Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I like this board overall. It works well with Ryzen 3000 series cpus out of the box and was simple to setup. UEFI/BIOS is easy to use. Plenty of room for expansions as well. My one complaint is that there is no ARGB header on this board. That's my fault for assuming it was just a standard thing...but it isn't. I ordered a used one from Amazon Warehouse and it was basically new and only missing one thing listed on the box but it wasn't important so I can't fault it there. I bought it open boxed and that's what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Chrono32123

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized.
customer_reviews.text: This is the replacement board for my gamer, upgraded from ASUS Maiximus VI Hero (which was limited to AM3+). I also purchased the AMD Ryzen 5 2600 Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler, 16GB (2x8GB) TEAMGROUP T-Force Delta RGB DDR4 3200MHz (PC4-25600)... No problems with installation or setup in my NZXT Phantom 530 case. This PC is now rated to be able to run 100% of all modern games at REQUIRED settings, over 98% of games at RECOMMENDED settings and better than 95% at ULTRA settings... Been running (mostly) Fallout 4 and Witcher3 for just under a year at maxed settings for long periods of time with no heating or noise problems...
customer_reviews.author: Russell Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Its a motherboard, Its good.
customer_reviews.text: I recommend it. It worked for me right off the bat. It looks pretty good. It overclock better than my old X370 board, which is really nice. I was able to get a 4.1 Ghz OC on my Ryzen 5 1600x without even trying. I have yet to actually push this board to its limits, but i'm sure I would be impressed if I did. You should buy this motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: TrustingCarton

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with 3rd gen ryzen processors
customer_reviews.text: The bios was already updated to 3003 which supports ryzen 3. I paired this board with a ryzen 3900x and it detected without problem. I would not normally pair a 3900x with this board but higher end motherboard availability and cost were issues due to COVID-19.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Sessoms

customer_reviews.title: love this board
customer_reviews.text: so first off, the shipping took forever, but with everything going on , I ain't gonna hold that against anyone... I will say this board had the newer bios update and was up and running with a ryzen 5 processor like butter! it looks great and it runs great.
customer_reviews.author: steve gritchen

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Motherboard Yet BIOS leaves A LOT to be Desired
customer_reviews.text: Well made motherboard, great looking and overall decent performance. However, Asus' implementation of the American Megatrends BIOS leaves a lot to be desired in regards to being intuitive. The overclocking toolset in this BIOS is lackluster compared to say MSI's or Gigabytes' implementations (MSI is my typical 'go to' board manufacturer but wanted to give Asus a try again). While I don't regret my purchase, I would not recommend this board to a friend. I will probably pass this on to the kids VERY SOON and get the MSI Tomahawk instead.
customer_reviews.author: Zemat

customer_reviews.title: Extremely simple to setup
customer_reviews.text: I got this motherboard, along with 32GB of RAM and a Rizen 7 processor with Wraith cooler. This whole setup went together smoothly, and a quick install using Windows 10 (1903) with a Samsung SSD, it is FAST. This was one of the easiest setups I've done in a long time. Loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott  Pederson

customer_reviews.title: ASUS ROG Strix B450-F
customer_reviews.text: Excellent motherboard for mining if you wanna build a 6 GPU rig. I have 3 of these boards all with newer AMD CPU's. This is a plug and play board for mining, you don't have to mess with the bios. Just sync up your 1st graphics card on the motherboard before moving to riser if you use a riser. This particular motherboard has been in operation 24/7 for more than 30 days now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has some issues.
customer_reviews.text: Asus having some quality control issues? Board won't post, stuck on DRAM light. Individual components tested on Gigabyte Ax370 board and found to be in order. Cleared CMOS, tried "Asus Crashfree Bios 3" to boot from USB and force install of latest BIOS file (if it didn't have it already), to no avail. Pity because it is such a beautiful mobo. Specs installed - CPU: AMD r5 2600 RAM: DDR 4 Corsair Vengeance LED 3000 PSU: Corsair VS650 Will RMA and hopefully get something with similar spec soon.
customer_reviews.author: Manfred

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality, terrible design issues depending on your case.
customer_reviews.text: First off let me start by saying this is a nice good quality Mobo and had very nice features, however there is two issues with this Mobo. The first issue is the pre installed I/o shield, it makes it very difficult to screw in the Mobo depending on your case and can actually get a screw stuck under it if you don't have a magnetic screwdriver and a surgeons hand lol, the second issue is the location of the fan headers. If you don't use PST PWM fans you will not be able to use 6 fans due to the location of the fan headers and the fact there is only 5 headers including the cpu fan.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Kingly

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my previous mother board with this on. The price was right when paired with a AMD Ryzen 5 2600X and an ASUS ROG RTX 2080 video card. All my old games have come alive again and new games like Battlefield V DX12 at highest setting have no sticking or noticeable frame loss.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: This motherboard doesnt like SATA
customer_reviews.text: It also did not meet my expectations when I read the specs so I don't like it. I had to slightly compromise my planned expansions so it was a big let down. Don't think you will be able to use all of the space on this board in any capacity. Think of it like your car has air conditioning but you cant use it at the same time as the radio and to change what you want to use, you have to go under the hood.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Colley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Love the easy to read manual
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderful, easy to read manual, board lights up by the CPU. This MOBO can handle 2 on board SSDs, the slots are below the CPU and below the Vid card. Make sure to read the manual during set up for the SATA 3 m, RGB hook up and make sure to hook Vid card in the PCI 1 slot closer to the CPU. Definitely recommend this MOBO.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Scott

customer_reviews.title: Faults Claims
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was doing an Asus ARGB build. The board is amazing except that the Aura it says it's compatible with seems to just be the board and CPU cooler because the RGB headers on this board are 4 pin 12v and all the Aura stuff I have that's is Asus Aura compatible requires a 3 pin 5v so yeah. I'm not sure who this problem would fall under but it suck when you finish a build with regrets. This was my first and last Asus build and parts.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Not best board for novice need to know you stuff to get most out of this board
customer_reviews.text: The bios great for manual over clocking however does not recognize processor or memory correctly even when using chips that are listed as supported so using the auto or AI overclock feature it underclocks everything.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: This cheap board functions. The bios is not the greatest. This board boots very very slowly.. None of the SATA ports work. Maybe that's why the crappy driver disc would not load. Now I have to take my whole computer apart, and don't know whether to get another one of these boards. My asus strix 1660 geforce matches it. I think I have to get a different one. What a pain. Should have known better than to cheap out. Don't do it
customer_reviews.author: AFS Instructor

customer_reviews.title: Corsair rgb ram not on asus's QVL
customer_reviews.text: bought this board to upgrade my pc from an intel build i had. then bought 16gb of corsair rgb pro ram @3000mhz. no matter what i do ram only runs at 1500mhz according to cpu z and icue software. turns out the ram isnt even on asus's QVL list!? ive even searched through all of amazons most popular rgb kits and cant find a single one that is on the list. such bs.
customer_reviews.author: Punisher6791

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from Amazon Warehouse deals
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard is no good, only the first ram slot is stable, and stable is an overstatement. Unfortunately it took me over a month to get my ryzen and my ram kit, so I missed my return window. Never order from Amazon Warehouse deals, I have 3 times now and on 2 of those occasions the "quality inspected" product was defective and not ready for resale, super unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The RGB sometimes fails.
customer_reviews.text: Installed the motherboard with all the other components. Everything was nice and easy. Got into Windows 10, installed the software to control the RGB. Sometimes it just forgets what I set it to. So I have to launch the software and reset it. The other thing is the Sonic Studio 3. It doesn't like to have multiple windows open (Firefox) so it can't tell which audio source to apply the effects. But I'm not going to take any points away for software issues. They can be fixed later down the road. As for the hardware I haven't had any problems with that.
customer_reviews.author: David Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: ASUS ROG B450 is a bad Motherboard,
customer_reviews.text: NOT SATISFIED! This has been the most buggy motherboard I have ever used. Several of the BIOS features are impossible to set properly. Trying to set this MB to boot to a boot to a bookable CD or DVD is impossible. I will never buy an ASUS MB again. Note! I've been building computers for 26 years and do so for businesses.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Goshbeverly

customer_reviews.title: Came with 3003 BIOS dated 12/09/2019, fully compatible with Ryzen 3000 series.
customer_reviews.text: Work's as intended, good memory compatibility, and good overclock capabilities, just one little thing: it's unbelievable that a good MB like this doesn't come with screws an stand-off. If you don't have enough -9 are required- you are in trouble.
customer_reviews.author: dribernal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome board!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this board for my first ever pc build. I switched from consoles and could not be happier about my choice. It was a pleasure building with this board and all of the other components I picked for my build. Also I noticed some reviewers complaining about the ROG RBG on the board causing them to get kicked out of games due to anti-cheat, but I have not ran into that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Ryzen 5 2600x
customer_reviews.text: Used it in my new gaming rig and it worked perfectly. Specs are as follows. This mobo, 2x 1tb m.2 NVME SSD, ryzen 5 2600x, AMD RX580, Corsair 650w PSU. Runs perfectly with everything. The port layout is perfectly fine. Ran into no issues installing everything. Came with both screws for the nvme slots which is exactly what I needed. Haven't needed tech support or used the lock feature, giving both 5 stars unless an issue occurs I'll change my review then.
customer_reviews.author: ThisIsMyPenName

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Last year we built a computer for my husband with this and now we are starting to build my computer and figured we were going to build the same one. We received this and put it all together just to find out the RGB ports don’t work which is the only reason why I gave it 4 stars. Will have to return this one to get a fully working one.
customer_reviews.author: Mickayla Clark

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Faulty USB ports
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a new gaming rig and had everything installed correctly. When I turned it on it said there was no mouse or key board detected. Couldn't do much with a keyboard connection so restarted the computer a few times. Each time it was stated that there was no connection to the keyboard even after taking out everything but the bare minimum components. Several google searches later showed that this is a known issue and most people just replaced the motherboard altogether. Sent this back and bought an MSI B550 instead. Everything connected first time around. Disappointing for a really nice looking mb.
customer_reviews.author: Laraib Azmat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect board for many different purposes
customer_reviews.text: This board is perfect for a gaming computer, audio/video workstation, or anything else you might need a computer for. Very good value and worked great for me
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support Ryzen 9?
customer_reviews.text: I pulled a working ryzen 9 3900x from a board, put it in here, and no image. Had to purchase a Ryzen 3 CPU to do the BIOS update, but the bios was already updated to the latest (12/2019) So while it worked with a Ryzen 3, it refused to run my Ryzen 9 3900x (the reason I bought this Mobo for). Returning it will be!
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: It is a good quality plate
customer_reviews.text: A good performance board good for performance, handles well the graphic card of RTX 2060, Prosesador ryzen 5 last generation. comfortable to assemble. I recommend for a HIGH AND MEDIUM RANGE GAMER PC
customer_reviews.author: Jose L Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Victory
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid board, I've been running it for a month non-stop and haven't had a stutter. Highly recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Prototype

customer_reviews.title: Very solid for gaming on AMD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with a 3800x to replace a 2nd gen i7 setup. It is noticeably faster and more responsive. I am very happy with it despite some minor issues with some of the rgb lighting compatibility and XMP. While a bios update corrected the XMP issues RGB is still not working correctly even though it's listed as compatible.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Spend more for quality, this motherboard came dead
customer_reviews.text: Board came dead. At first I thought I hooked it up wrong because I couldnt get the motherboard to even light up. I took it to a professional technician and he told me that the motherboard was dead. Now I cant request an exchange because I bought it from amazon and now only third party sellers offer it. Im really upset because now the board is $40 more from other sellers and I have to uninstall my pc and return the motherboard to buy a new one and hook up my pc all over again. Overall, really disappointed and I will be looking at better alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Ross P.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: Put everything together and have been trying for several HOURS to boot into BIOS or give me a splash screen. Nothing. Everything lights up, but NO beeps of any kind and nothing on the monitor. Guess it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Maumus

customer_reviews.title: Great mainboard for Ryzen
customer_reviews.text: The one minus for this is that the SATA ports are right underneath the video card (if you have a monster-sized card like I do that's longer than the motherboard is wide!). Can't switch drives on the fly... :( Plenty of fan and LED controllers, USB3.1, all that jazz. Installed and ran right away.
customer_reviews.author: D. Combellick

customer_reviews.title: very dissapointed, it wont boot
customer_reviews.text: The product worked fine for a couple of months, and just a few days ago it suddenly wouldnt boot when trying to turn on the computer. i tried all the other parts of my PC with another motherboard and they worked fine. REALLY DISSAPOINTED in this product, i spent a lot of time working to buy my first PC and getting such a bad quality product is a real boomer, its sad to see lots of reviews here that are experiencing the same problem
customer_reviews.author: ivan terrero

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6months...
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months it started to not recognizes sata drives after that and multiple bios restored I gave up and I got and msi board no problems at all with that one it worked right out of the box, I used to be an asus guy, no anymore by the way the support make it impossible to rma their products..
customer_reviews.author: marcelobonifacio

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy once I received a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a faulty one and it cost me $50 from a PC shop to find out. But they replaced it quickly. Sent me another one before I even sent the original back.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Young

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this like the plague or the Covid-19
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this like the plague or the Covid-19. Random crashes, and blue screens. The board look pretty, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Neno

customer_reviews.title: Very nice motherboard for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this motherboard a lot. It looks good, and the expansion slots for M.2 are very nice. Keep in mind that using these drives disables the SATA drives.
customer_reviews.author: S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Value and quality
customer_reviews.text: I used this Mobo for my very first PC build and it was very very easy, it has a bunch of USB ports came with an io shield onboard RGB easy to use bios minor overclock capability has a USB type c Port and tons of audio ports... Honestly I don't know a whole lot about motherboards but this one has been great also with a bios update it'll run 3rd gen amd processors. I haven't had any problems at all and it was pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy with Ryzen 7
customer_reviews.text: Need to flash bios for Ryzen 7. While it supports newer CPUs, I can only imagine it's not going to be future proof. I still can't get my cpu fan to be recognized. However I can ignore it in the bios and run it at 100%. I can adjust through and driver. (Wraith fan) They should not advertise that it works with newer CPUs of it doesn't support 100%. Aside from the cpu headache, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: stefan barber

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good board
customer_reviews.text: Bought this board to pair it with a 3400G for a build for my family. Once I flashed the firmware as was expected, popped the 3400G in place and everything is working like a dream. Also, I absolutely love the Asus bios. I had a previous aaus board the strix b450i which i returned as i didnt get it to work. I'm glad i gave asus another chance.
customer_reviews.author: H Sobers

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mobo, glowy, nerd stuff
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a pain in the rear with cable management and certain mid tower ATXs but it looks nice, was easy to boot up and has plenty of ports for all your nerd needs. Only gripe is how close the ram is seated by the CPU and how very careful you must be when installing CPU cooler fans. Other than that it boots damn fast with ryzen CPUs and solid state drives.
customer_reviews.author: T@A

customer_reviews.title: great for work stations and gaming
customer_reviews.text: just built 3 desktop gaming machines 2 with our previous hard drive, video cards on the 2 we received a DOA board Amazon shipped up a return someday these are rock solid motherboards that can have on hell of a gaming rig built upon them we are running Ryzen 5 2700X with 16gig of ram ear with a 4 gig nvidia cards on our sons he opted for a ATI 8 gig card that is in love with
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Decent Motherboard, No ARGB
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent motherboard, but it has no A-RGB outputs. If I had known this before I purchased it, I wouldn't have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Just got it today and so far no problems!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, glad it has more expansions of sata ports grb headers, 4 4 pins for fans which this has a lot of things that my old board didn't have so this is great. Though I hope it does stay the way it is with no problems for a long time, hopefully.
customer_reviews.author: Kaiga

customer_reviews.title: Not powering on after approximately 6 months of owning.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this board on December 20th 2019, everything went very smoothly from delivery to assembly. However, upon shutting down as one normally would, and attempting to switch back on the computer, I noticed that the ROG Logo on the board between the I/O shield and the CPU would blink white once, and that's it. Nothing powers on, no posting etc. The computer is hooked up to a UPS and all other procedures done properly. I've tested the Power Supply separately using the paperclip method and the PSU turns on fine. Can anyone share some feedback or advice on how to remedy this? Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Avish

customer_reviews.title: Was great till they killed cpu support
customer_reviews.text: bought this board with a ryzen 7 1700 3.7 ghz cpu. Ran great for about 6 months until i updated the bios and got a red light at post on the cpu. Long story short customer service at asus sure sucks the dickens cause the guy told me it wasnt on the support list and he couldnt help me. awesome
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lyles

customer_reviews.title: The ease of the setup is understated
customer_reviews.text: With all products you get both the good and the bad apples. My last pc was a mistake to purchase since it was a major box office brand and cheaply made in my opinion.. the sff board had issues... my mistake for buying a prebuilt. Setting up this board was extremely easy, specially with the added component packages.. which made is nice. Took me about an hour to setup and route cables, plug in and get running Only thing i would have suggested was to have an additional mounting bracket for the cpu fan.. .I installed a Ryzen 5 2600x with a wraith spire cooler - and it requires the removal of the preinstalled mounting brackets
customer_reviews.author: rex v

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it's a really cool board. It was my number one pick but out of stock when I built mine and got this as a standby. Used it in a build for my girlfriends friends rig and it's really nice. I've always preferred Asus bios and had really good luck with them and MSI boards, definitely didn't disappoint, just jealous that I didn't get to keep it. Very stable, tons of controls and ram had no issues at 3600MHz cl14 with a trident z neo kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, though it’s VERY delicate. It took me maybe 10-25min to install into my build, The dual RGB headers are a life saver for cable management, has lots of headers for fans, the built in RGB look great. Overall, great motherboard for the price, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jay 🦺

customer_reviews.title: bah
customer_reviews.text: was building a gaming machine. i had to make it a Linux machine instead because this board would not let me install windows 7. I will quit using computers before I will use windows 10. in fact since Microsoft's business model became so predatory I don't want to use any of their products
customer_reviews.author: martin knox

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 5 3600 Compatible,  but need manual OC
customer_reviews.text: Board is one if the best in terms of features, my only concern is with Ryzen 5 3600. The only way to make it work was via manually overclocking the CPU, NOT SURE why the board on auto cause a boot loop. Successfully running my Ryzen 5 3600 @ 4.2 OC.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pimentel

customer_reviews.title: 2 separate ordered both faulty original and replacement sent!
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more disappointed in a product. I ordered faulty motherboard... sent it back and got a replacement... the replacement was also faulty. Eneded up taking my computer to a shop and they ran test there confirming they were faulty. Dont waist your time or money on this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING MOB
customer_reviews.text: Bought one before from Best Buy but there was something wrong with that one and I wanted to get another one so I tried buying one from Best Buy Again and they were sold out, so I managed to find one on here and it works PERFECTLY.
customer_reviews.author: Blackapino

customer_reviews.title: Clean Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a good AM4 B450 board. No usb 3.2 gen 2 ports so if you case has them, this look somewhere else. The ASUS Aura software is honestly is terrible. It drags the board down. Everything else hardware wise is good but that software is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Hurracayne

customer_reviews.title: Stop eating P&J's next to your electronics. Also do not build computers while taking a baths.
customer_reviews.text: Update bios, out of the chute. XMP Profile like everyone has said. I have ran Corsair Vengeance DDR4 3000 and 3200. Stable decent for the money. I have 100 plus builds this year using this board and a few others. None have had a problem. Stop eating P&J's next to your electronics. Also do not build computers while taking a baths.
customer_reviews.author: M Technologies Inc.

customer_reviews.title: It Supports 3rd gen AMD
customer_reviews.text: if you guys were worried like me if it would support 3rd than then relax because it does.
customer_reviews.author: Juel Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 2012's gaming rig with this motherboard and I am very content with its performance. Installation was a cake walk and the only critique I have was the MOBO did not come with screws. I had ti reuse the existing screws of my previous MOBO.
customer_reviews.author: WOewok

customer_reviews.title: Good but know that you need wifi solutions
customer_reviews.text: Works well for me, only issue I have with this is that it has fewer case fan ports than the amount of fans my case has, so I had to buy port splitters. It doesn't have a wifi card so you have to buy a pcie wifi card or a usb antenna. But it is a nice motherboard, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Denekamp

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard with lots of expansion slots
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard has solid construction, easy to use BIOS, easy overclocking, and nice aesthetics. Installed my Ryzen 7 2700 in it and it posted right away. Asus motherboards are the best in my opinion, I have a Asus K53E laptop(2011) that is still running 9 years later.
customer_reviews.author: Mike_B622

customer_reviews.title: Way more pros then cons
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my very first ever build and love it! Pros: easy install,pretty much plug and play,RGB,and can be a great continued upgrade. Cons: I put a ryzen 5 2600 in and the shroud hits the amd fan so I rotated the fan and now it blocks one of the ram slots, it’s a big motherboard but that area has a lot crammed in together with little room. Can’t change RGB on logo so it cycles colors. Love it still and totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: One of the most reliable, Non issued Boards I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I got this thing right out of the box to build my computer, Moments after finishing the build. Plugged it in, Got an immediate post. The one thing I would say isn't the best is that you can't (Or at least I haven't found a way) To disable the Mem/Cpu/Disk Check that is performed every time you boot your computer. I like that it does some extra steps to check the health of every thing, but I don't necessarily like how it takes around 9 seconds for it to finish. Small thing to complain about compared to the rest of the board. I love it, Best addition to a gaming PC in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: 2 Boards down, none to go.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these boards for new PC build, the first one worked (save for the front microphone port, it was shot) for a bout 2-3 months. It stopped working. FF a little, i've just received my replacement board, the same kind..... DOA. Nothing, no lights no beeps. No PSU activation. All in all, im very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Would have liked more SATA ports
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad mother board especially for sub $100 but I really wish this trend of trading SATA ports for other things would stop. The add-on stickers are a bit silly TBH but it's not like I was expecting RGBs in this price range I would have rather saved a few more bucks than have had to pay for those in the overall price.
customer_reviews.author: JessieTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Despite it being a refurbished motherboard, it arrived well packaged and works as intended. While it did not come with a manual or any screws cables etc (this was disclosed in the item description before I purchased it so it wasn't a surprise), it did come in an anti-static bag and had protective plastic on the heatsink, northbridge, etc. It looked abosultely brand new once unpacked. Also, the manufacturer included a business card and emailed me directly to mke sure everything worked ok, which I felt was classy as well.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great Mobo
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to get installed and the user manual is very informative. I am enjoying my new setup.
customer_reviews.author: Vic G.

product_meta.title: Asus ROG Strix B450-F Gaming Motherboard (ATX) AMD Ryzen 2 AM4 DDR4 DP HDMI M.2 USB 3.1 Gen2 B450
product_meta.description: Experience next level performance with the ROG Strix B450 F Gaming, powered by 2nd generation AMD Ryzen AM4 processors. Unlock your system's potential with 5 Way Optimization featuring Fan Xpert 4 while personalizing your build with Aura Sync RGB. Integrated NVMe M.2, gigabit LAN and USB 3.1 Gen2 deliver maximum connectivity speeds.
feature_bullets: Powered by 2nd generation AMD Ryzen AM4 and 7th generation Athlon processors to maximize connectivity and speed with dual NVMe M.2, USB 3.1 Gen2, gigabit LAN and up to 64 Gigabytes of DDR4 (3200 Megahertz)
5 Way Optimization with Auto Tuning and Fan Xpert 4 automatically tailors overclocking profiles to your unique build for maximum OC performance and dynamic system cooling
Aura Sync RGB lighting plus 2 additional RGB headers provide a nearly endless spectrum of colors with the ability to synchronize effects across an ever expanding ecosystem of enabled products
Pre mounted I/O shield ensures streamlined installation and represents ROG’s attention to detail and quality

Industry leading 8 channel HD audio with the ROG exclusive Supreme FX S1220A driven by Japanese capacitors. Operating System Windows 10 64 bit. Audio Feature including optical S/PDIF out port(s) at back panel, Sonic Radar III, Sonic Studio III + Sonic Studio Link

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,124 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
